channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: They fly four-and-a-half hours from New South Wales to Birdsville where they now own two businesses.
item.title: Pilot mum and tourism-savvy father-of-five bank on Birdsville tourism

item.description: Biden was also asked whether he's considered what would happen if Trump refused to vacate the presidency in the event he wasn't reelected.
item.title: Biden fears Trump to 'steal this election'

item.dc:creator: Megan Levy
item.description: The global death toll from coronavirus has passed 417,000 and there are more than 7.4 million known cases of infection, according to Johns Hopkins University.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 7.4 million as Australian death toll stands at 102

item.description: If you need your teeth cleaned or a cavity filled, the dentist is the only option. This makes them, in the eyes of some economists, the perfect barometer for gauging America's recovery from the shock of the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: How’s the economy doing? Watch the dentists

item.description: Wall Street is on track for its worst day in three months, setting up the ASX for more heavy losses, as coronavirus cases increase again, deflating recent optimism that the economy could recover quickly as lockdowns ease.
item.title: Wall Street plummets on rising number of virus cases, dire economic forecast

item.description: Brazilians critical of their government's ambiguous response to a surging coronavirus pandemic have dug 100 graves on Rio's Copacabana Beach.
item.title: Graves dug in Copacabana Beach to protest handling of COVID-19 pandemic

item.description: The patient, who is in her 20s, was on a ventilator and heart-lung machine for almost two months before her operation.
item.title: Coronavirus survivor in US receives double lung transplant

item.description: "As a commissioned uniformed officer, it was a mistake that I have learned from," General Mark Milley said of his walk with Trump through Lafayette Square.
item.title: America's top general says he was wrong to accompany Trump to church

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: Coronavirus brought Australian rugby to its knees. Hamish McLennan has some bold and controversial new ideas for how to get the game back on its feet.
item.title: 'A new day': New rugby chair bullish on Australia's future

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: The incoming Rugby Australia chairman wants to get creative with the professional game, citing private equity investment in English soccer giants as a model for success.
item.title: Manchester City model could work for rugby, says McLennan

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Job ad numbers have climbed more than 60 per cent since April as the economy reopens.
item.title: Job ads on the march ... as we try to lose our shirts online

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Australians may have access to phone and video consultations with specialists, GPs and psychologists beyond September as the federal government considers extending Medicare rebates for telehealth services.
item.title: Medicare rebates for telehealth may be extended beyond September

item.dc:creator: Dale Sheridan
item.description: I took the scenic route to womanhood - but now I'm here I shouldn't have to justify my existence.
item.title: Dear J.K. Rowling, I'm a woman so let's end this toxic 'debate'

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Household power bills are expected to fall after the Morrison government approved energy market reforms to help prevent costly spikes in electricity demand.
item.title: 'Ambitious' energy reforms set to cut household power bills

item.dc:creator: Dominic Perrottet
item.description: Governments must find the courage to overhaul the taxes that are stifling Australia.
item.title: We can't govern by focus group - it's time for brave, nation-wide tax reform

item.description: The federal government can defuse the situation by taking racism in our society seriously.
item.title: Protesters will pack up if PM moves on equality

item.description: Take this one as a comment: I don't want to continue working from home.
item.title: Where will we work when the 'new normal' is just the norm?

item.dc:creator: Larissa Ham
item.description: Go too hard, too early and you’ll find yourself stuck on the couch again – this time with an unwelcome injury.
item.title: How to return to the gym without injuring yourself

item.dc:creator: John Huxley
item.description: On June 12, 2006, Tim Cahill scored Australia's first ever goal at the FIFA World Cup finals, in a thrilling come from behind victory over Japan.
item.title: From the Archives, 2006: Australia's historic World Cup win over Japan

item.description: Trivia and word buffs: test your knowledge with today's superquiz and Target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Friday, June 12

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Ferraris were never designed to be inconspicuous. So is it any wonder that the former head of Ferrari has had so much trouble keeping the hood down on a legal battle?
item.title: Ferrari battle attempts to engage stealth mode

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: Richmond and Collingwood played a draw and afterwards the coaches were on the same page too.
item.title: 'Bizarre' game leaves coaches scratching their heads

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Those who want Morrison to act on Indigenous justice can show him the moral case for doing so, but they need a political case, too.
item.title: Indigenous injustice: endless caution leads to permanent inaction

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Chinese students often suffer from exclusion in Australia though racist violence is rare, study finds, contrary to warnings from China's Ministry of Education.
item.title: Chinese students see political motive in Beijing's call to stay away

item.dc:creator: Kerrie O'Brien
item.description: The writer and actor said he was prepared to "get heat" after he delivered a powerful anti-racism monologue on Q&A on Monday night.
item.title: 'You grow a thick skin very early': Meyne Wyatt on his Q&A monologue

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: A Ringwood North couple have put their rubbish bin out just once in the past 12 months and, no, it wasn't a huge skip.
item.title: 'Chockers': Couple go one year without putting the bin out

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: Nathan Buckley said he would again try to contact ex-player Héritier Lumumba to talk to him about the premiership player's repeated claims he was racially vilified in his time at the club.
item.title: Collingwood coach wants to speak to ex-player Lumumba over racism claims

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 12, 2020

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: AFL sources were adamant relaxation of the draconian rules would only come with the backing of state governments and their respective chief health officers.
item.title: AFL to review coronavirus protocols after round two

item.description: An "enrolment at all costs" mindset is not the answer for universities or the students press-ganged into funding them in desperate times.
item.title: We need to avoid our own 'obsession with university'

item.description: Gone With the Wind, let it be said again, isn't cancelled. It's simply being reframed.
item.title: HBO Max isn't censoring Gone With the Wind, it's reframing it

item.description: Colonial monuments that have long stood unchallenged in the hearts of our communities might well be a focus for dialogue and debate.
item.title: Call to topple monuments is an opportunity for debate

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Footy is back with the Tigers and the Pies set to meet at a deserted MCG on Thursday night.
item.title: AFL 2020 Live updates: Magpies and Tigers play out draw

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: This was a low scoring, patient, tactical, tight, gritty, desperate game and deserving of 100,000 people. In the event it had everything but a crowd.
item.title: Lockdown turns to deadlock as Pies, Tigers draw

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Manly rattled home on the back of seven second-half penalties to beat Brisbane 20-18, but lost Marty Taupau to a broken thumb.
item.title: Manly of steel: Gritty Sea Eagles dig deep to run down Broncos

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: State governments are considering charging Australians returning from overseas to pay for their own hotel quarantine after forking out millions of dollars.
item.title: National cabinet to consider charging travellers for hotel quarantine

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Footy was back on Thursday night,allowing the Seven Network to unveil new atmospherics in a bid to counter a crowd-less MCG when the Magpies and Tigers did battle.
item.title: Fans not there but TV coverage lifts 'spirits' on AFL return

item.dc:creator: Georgina Mitchell
item.description: Police brought an urgent application on Thursday in a bid to have the Refugee Action Coalition rally prohibited, but organisers said the protest will still go ahead.
item.title: Sydney refugee rally prohibited by NSW Supreme Court

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: Brisbane try to bounce back from a record defeat but Manly will have other ideas as they clash at Central Coast Stadium.
item.title: NRL 2020 LIVE updates: Manly Sea Eagles vs Brisbane Broncos at Central Coast Stadium

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Monash University is pushing ahead with a deal to help a Chinese company build a new passenger plane, despite concerns some of the designs have been stolen.
item.title: Australian uni continuing work on Chinese plane linked to espionage claims

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: The global death toll from coronavirus has passed 413,000 and there are more than 7.3 million known cases of infection, according to Johns Hopkins University.
item.title: As it happened: Melbourne Black Lives Matter protest attendee contracts COVID-19 as NSW rolls back restrictions, Australian death toll stands at 102

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: Collingwood and Richmond relaunch the AFL season with a thoughtful gesture and a fierce contest.
item.title: Footy returns with a matter of respect and solidarity

item.description: Not a sweat if you're not worried. Mate.
item.title: Forests of urban myths and some shameless spruiking

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: The AFL has signed off on a revised broadcast deal as it restarts, with Seven set to receive a 19 per cent discount and a two-year extension.
item.title: AFL secures revised broadcast deal with Seven and Foxtel

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Seeking to claim their first victory in more than 11 months, Melbourne have dropped almost a third of their team that lost to West Coast round one.
item.title: Seventh hell: Demons cut deep in search of breakthrough victory

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Only 11 nurses have been trained to use rape kits in the 12 months since a damning report said victims had to wait for hours to be examined.
item.title: Rape victims left waiting for DNA tests amid training shortfall

item.description: For 30 seconds in the middle of the ground, the players and umpires took the knee.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Footy Live

item.description: Australia's most outspoken tennis star asked Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer what they thought about the grand slam going ahead.
item.title: Kyrgios denounces ATP over 'selfish' US Open plans

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: It may be impossible to trace all the close contacts of a protester who tested positive for coronavirus after attending Melbourne's Black Lives Matter protest, Victoria's top health official says.
item.title: 'May be impossible' to trace contacts of Black Lives Matter protester with COVID-19
